function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Higher density associated with higher rates of mortality from and transmission of highly contagious diseases, including COVID-19.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread and higher mortality rates in densely populated areas.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to control disease spread, such as vaccination campaigns and public health initiatives.","Technologies":"Public health initiatives, vaccination technology, contact tracing apps.","People":"Residents in densely populated areas, urban planners, public health officials.","Owner":"Government, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Lack of in-depth research on measuring connectivity in cities and its impact on the spread of pandemics.","Impact":"Limited understanding of how connectivity affects disease spread and mortality rates, leading to potential inadequacy in urban planning and public health initiatives.","Mitigation":"Conduct more extensive research on measuring urban connectivity and its impact on disease spread. Implement data-driven urban planning strategies.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, urban connectivity mapping technology, GIS software.","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies."},{"Description":"Low number of studies examining the impact of density on highly contagious new infections.","Impact":"Limited knowledge about the relationship between density and disease spread, leading to potential misconceptions and inadequate urban planning policies.","Mitigation":"Encourage and fund more research on the impact of density on disease spread. Use research findings to inform urban planning and public health strategies.","Technologies":"Research funding, data collection and analysis tools, GIS software.","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies."}]}
